intro: Spermacoce exasperata, commonly known as the devil's bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an herbaceous perennial or shrub. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves and produces small, clustered white or pink flowers. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Spermacoce exasperata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
